intro: Lappula cupulata, commonly known as the cup-shaped lappula, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the family Polygonaceae, which includes plants such as buckwheat and sorrel. The plant is characterized by its basal rosette of leaves and its small, greenish-yellow flowers that appear in late summer. Its fruit is a three-lobed capsule that splits open to release the seeds. Lappula cupulata is often found in disturbed soils and can thrive in a variety of habitats, including roadsides and meadows.
